description: Deploys an EKS cluster in a new VPC (qs-1p7nknoht)

templateBody.Description: Deploys an EKS cluster in a new VPC (qs-1p7nknoht)

Label.default: MuleSoft Anypoint Runtime Fabric (AWS Partner Integration)

VaultUIACMSSLCertificateArn.default: Vault UI ACM SSL certificate ARN

VaultUIDomainName.default: Vault UI load balancer DNS name

ConsulUIDomainName.default: Consul UI load balancer DNS name

MuleLicenseKeyinbase64.default: Mule License Key in Base 64 Format

AvailabilityZones.Description: List of Availability Zones to use for the subnets in the VPC. Three Availability Zones are used for this deployment.

KeyPairName.Description: Name of an existing key pair, which allows you to securely connect to your instance after it launches. Leave empty to proceed without a key pair. You would need to use AWS Systems Manager Session Manager to connect to the provisioned EC2 instances.

PrivateSubnet1CIDR.ConstraintDescription: CIDR block parameter must be in the form x.x.x.x/16–28
PrivateSubnet1CIDR.Description: CIDR block for private subnet 1, located in Availability Zone 1.

PrivateSubnet2CIDR.ConstraintDescription: CIDR block parameter must be in the form x.x.x.x/16–28
PrivateSubnet2CIDR.Description: CIDR block for private subnet 2, located in Availability Zone 2.

PrivateSubnet3CIDR.ConstraintDescription: CIDR block parameter must be in the form x.x.x.x/16–28
PrivateSubnet3CIDR.Description: CIDR block for private subnet 3, located in Availability Zone 3.

PublicSubnet1CIDR.ConstraintDescription: CIDR block parameter must be in the form x.x.x.x/16–28
PublicSubnet1CIDR.Description: CIDR block for the public (DMZ) subnet 1, located in Availability Zone 1.

PublicSubnet2CIDR.ConstraintDescription: CIDR block parameter must be in the form x.x.x.x/16–28
PublicSubnet2CIDR.Description: CIDR block for the public (DMZ) subnet 2, located in Availability Zone 2.

PublicSubnet3CIDR.ConstraintDescription: CIDR block parameter must be in the form x.x.x.x/16–28
PublicSubnet3CIDR.Description: CIDR block for the public (DMZ) subnet 3, located in Availability Zone 3.

QSS3BucketName.ConstraintDescription: Quick Start bucket name can include numbers, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, and hyphens (-). It cannot start or end with a hyphen (-).
QSS3BucketName.Description: S3 bucket name for the Quick Start assets. This string can include numbers, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, and hyphens (-). It cannot start or end with a hyphen (-).

QSS3KeyPrefix.ConstraintDescription: Quick Start key prefix can include numbers, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, hyphens (-), periods (.) and forward slash (/).
QSS3KeyPrefix.Description: S3 key prefix for the Quick Start assets. Quick Start key prefix can include numbers, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, hyphens (-), periods (.) and forward slash (/).

QSS3BucketRegion.Description: Region where the Quick Start S3 bucket (QSS3BucketName) is hosted. When using your own bucket, you must specify this value.

RemoteAccessCIDR.ConstraintDescription: CIDR block parameter must be in the form x.x.x.x/x
RemoteAccessCIDR.Description: CIDR IP range that is permitted to access the instances. We recommend that you set this value to a trusted IP range.

EKSPublicAccessEndpoint.Description: Configure access to the Kubernetes API server endpoint from outside of your VPC.

VPCCIDR.ConstraintDescription: CIDR block parameter must be in the form x.x.x.x/16–28

AdditionalEKSAdminUserArn.Description: (Optional) IAM user ARN to be granted administrative access to the EKS cluster.

AdditionalEKSAdminRoleArn.Description: (Optional) IAM role ARN to be granted administrative access to the EKS cluster.

NodeInstanceType.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid EC2 instance type

NumberOfNodes.Description: Number of Amazon EKS node instances. The default is one for each of the three Availability Zones.

MaxNumberOfNodes.Description: Maximum number of Amazon EKS node instances. The default is three.

ClusterAutoScaler.Description: Choose "Enabled" to enable Kubernetes cluster autoscaler.

EfsStorageClass.Description: Choose "Enabled" to enable EFS storage class.

MonitoringStack.Description: Enable monitoring stack with "Prometheus+Grafana." Warning: this is a legacy parameter and will be dropped from the next version of this Quick Start. Please use the "Grafana integration" and "Prometheus integration" parameters instead.

GrafanaIntegration.Description: Grafana requires "Prometheus integration" to be enabled. For more information see https://www.grafana.com/ .

NumberOfAZs.Description: Number of Availability Zones to use in the VPC. This must match the value entered for the AvailabilityZones parameter.

ProvisionBastionHost.Description: Skip creating a bastion host by choosing "Disabled."

ALBIngressController.Description: Choose "Disabled" to skip deploying the AWS load balancer controller.

FargateNamespaces.Description: (Optional) Comma-separated list of namespaces for which Fargate should be enabled.

FargateLabels.Description: Requires at least one Fargate namespace to be specified. This is a comma-separated list of key-value pod labels. For a pod to run on Fargate, all of the labels must match, and it must run in a namespace defined by "Fargate namespaces."

EKSClusterName.Description: (Optional) Name for the EKS cluster. If left blank, one is auto-generated. This must be unique within the Region.

SnykIntegrationId.Description: If the SnykIntegration parameter is set to "Enabled," a value must be provided. For more information, see https://support.snyk.io/hc/en-us/articles/360003916158-Install-the-Snyk-controller-with-Helm.

NewRelicLicenseKey.Description: If the NewRelicIntegration parameter is set to "Enabled," a value must be provided. For more information see https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/accounts/install-new-relic/account-setup/license-key/.

RafaySysProject.Description: This is the name you want to use for you Rafay deployment.

RafaySysBootstrapBucket.Description: (Optional) S3 bucket to place the the Rafay bootstrap yaml file. If left blank the EKS Quick Start bucket will be used.

RafaySysBootstrapKey.Description: (Optional) S3 key to place the the Rafay bootstrap yaml file. If left blank the key will be rafay/<CLUSTER_NAME>/cluster-bootstrap.yaml.

RafaySysApiKey.Description: Required if using an existing Rafay account.

RafaySysApiSecret.Description: Required if using an existing Rafay account.

RafaySysFirstName.Description: Required if registering a new Rafay account.

RafaySysLastName.Description: Required if registering a new Rafay account.

RafaySysOrganizationName.Description: Required if registering a new Rafay account.

RafaySysEmail.Description: Required if registering a new Rafay account.

PerAccountSharedResources.Description: Choose "No" if you already deployed another EKS Quick Start stack in your AWS account.

PerRegionSharedResources.Description: Choose "No" if you already deployed another EKS Quick Start stack in your Region.

ConfigSetName.Description: (Optional) Name used to map advanced parameters to an EKS cluster. If you launched an advanced configuration stack and want to apply its values to this cluster, this name must match the ConfigSetName parameter for the stack. If left blank, a new config set is created using default values.

TestSuite.Description: Deploys a test stack that tests Quick Start components.

NodeInstanceFamily.Description: Choose the instance family to match the value of "Node instance type."

NodeGroupType.Description: Choose "Unmanaged" to create an Auto Scaling group without using the EKS-managed node groups feature.

NodeGroupOS.Description: Operating system to use for node instances. Choose "Bottlerocket" for the Amazon purpose-built container OS (unmanaged node groups only). Note that if you choose "Windows," an additional Amazon Linux node group is created.

VaultUIDomainName.Description: Fully qualified DNS name for the vault-ui service load balancer. If you don't provide a value for "ACM SSL certificate ARN", use the HostedZoneID.

VaultUIHostedZoneID.Description: Route 53-hosted zone ID of the domain name. If you don't provide an ACMSSLCertificateArn value, the Quick Start creates an ACM certificate for you using HostedZoneID in conjunction with DomainName.

VaultUIACMSSLCertificateArn.Description: ARN of the load balancer's ACM SSL certificate. If you don't provide values for "Domain name" and "Hosted zone id", provide a value for "ACM SSL certificate ARN".

ConsulUIDomainName.Description: Fully qualified DNS name for the consul-ui service load balancer. If you don't provide a value for "ACM SSL certificate ARN", use the HostedZoneID.

ConsulUIHostedZoneID.Description: Route 53-hosted zone ID of the domain name. If you don't provide an ACMSSLCertificateArn value, the Quick Start creates an ACM certificate for you using HostedZoneID in conjunction with DomainName.

ConsulUIACMSSLCertificateArn.Description: ARN of the load balancer's ACM SSL certificate. If you don't provide values for "Domain name" and "Hosted zone id", provide a value for "ACM SSL certificate ARN".

RancherDomainName.Description: DNS domain name that users can use to access the Rancher console.

MuleLicenseKeyinbase64.Description: Mule License Key in Base 64 Format

Assertions.AssertDescription: AutDetect must be set/unset for both PerRegionSharedResources and PerAccountSharedResources
Managed nodegroups do not support Windows nodes.
You must specify at least one Fargate namespace to enable Fargate.
Vault: Please specify a 'Domain Name' if you specify 'Route 53 Hosted Zone ID'
Vault: Please specify a 'Route 53 Hosted Zone ID' if you specify 'Domain Name'
Vault1: Using an SSL certificate is enforced. A CertificateArn or a HostedZoneID and Domain Name must be provided.
Vault2: Using an SSL certificate is enforced. A CertificateArn or a HostedZoneID and Domain Name must be provided.
Consul: Please specify a 'Domain Name' if you specify 'Route 53 Hosted Zone ID'
Consul: Please specify a 'Route 53 Hosted Zone ID' if you specify 'Domain Name'
Consul1: Using an SSL certificate is enforced. A CertificateArn or a HostedZoneID and Domain Name must be provided.
Consul2: Using an SSL certificate is enforced. A CertificateArn or a HostedZoneID and Domain Name must be provided.
